commitment.title: Our commitment
commitment.desc: Discover our mission, vision, and values that guide our daily actions
commitment.missionDesc: HealthMOUR provides reliable information and develops the skills of individuals and organizations to optimize promotion and prevention actions in the areas where it operates.
commitment.visionDesc: A world where every community has access to quality healthcare, adequate nutrition, health education, and optimal hygiene conditions.
commitment.valuesDesc: Integrity, Credibility, Innovation, Inclusion, Diversity, Equity

hero.title: Our work
hero.desc: Discover our 2024-2026 strategic plan and our priority intervention areas to transform community health.

ourWork.planTitle: An integrated approach to community health
ourWork.planDesc:
HealthMOUR for well-being in a healthy and prosperous environment!
HealthMOUR through co-constructed projects and initiatives in health, nutrition, education, and water-hygiene-sanitation, focused on the priorities of local communities.
Our main pillars are:
â€” Production of reliable data for informed decision-making;
â€” Strengthening the capacities of communities and professionals to be effective and resilient;
â€” Strategic planning based on evidence for impactful activities, projects, and programs.
HealthMOUR is committed to creating a positive and lasting impact. Joining HealthMOUR means choosing actions by communities, for communities.
Together, let's make collective well-being our everyday reality!

areas.communityHealthDesc: Epidemiological monitoring and improvement of local health systems
areas.nutritionDesc: Nutrition programs and fight against malnutrition
areas.educationDesc: Awareness and training for health promotion
areas.washDesc: Improving access to drinking water and sanitation facilities

ourWork.impactDesc: Our commitment is part of a long-term vision of sustainable transformation of community health systems, with a focus on sustainability and community empowerment.
ourWork.impactDurabilityDesc: Sustainable solutions adapted to local contexts

founders.heroDesc: Meet the passionate team bringing HealthMOUR to life, composed of international experts united by a common vision.
founders.behindDesc: Discover the vision and commitment that gave birth to HealthMOUR
founders.founderTitle: Co-founder, team member and chairman of the board of directors
founders.founderBio:
Dr. Keita is a physician specialized in public health, with a particular focus on statistics and nutrition, and has over 15 years of experience in the field, both in the public and private sectors. He has strong expertise in designing and evaluating large-scale strategic plans in maternal, neonatal, child health, and nutrition (MNCH&N) at national, regional, and international levels. This experience gives him recognized mastery of methodologies focused on evaluating the impact of health and nutrition interventions.
In Mali, Dr. Keita has led several initiatives aimed at strengthening strategic planning and improving community health services. His achievements include developing an evaluation tool for Community Health Centers (CSCom) for their accreditation, as well as in-depth analysis of bottlenecks in governance and financial management of CSCom.
A proponent of evidence-based decision-making, he teaches the use of the "Lives Saved Tool" (LiST) and conducts introductory evaluation courses as part of the Master of Public Health program at the Department of Public Health Studies and Research at the University of Sciences, Techniques, and Technologies of Bamako. He has also contributed to the impact evaluation of numerous national and international strategic plans related to MNCH&N, proposing high-impact alternative scenarios.
Author and co-author of numerous scientific articles related to the planning and evaluation of health programs, Dr. Youssouf Keita is also co-founder, active member, and Chairman of the Board of the NGO HealthMOUR.
founders.teamDesc: A multicultural and multidisciplinary team bringing expertise and passion to every HealthMOUR project
founders.joinDesc: Do you share our passion for community health? We are always looking for committed talent to strengthen our team.

habibatou.role: Strategic communication professional for organizations, projects, development and change

fatoumata.speciality: Medical doctor with a Master 2 in Public Health specializing in nutrition. Since 2023, I have been with CHAI (Clinton Health Access Initiative), first as an intern, then as a program assistant from August 2024. Since April 2025, I have also been a coordinator at Large and Long-lasting Impact Seekers at Scale and Company (Llissco. SAS), where I supervise technical assistance to ANAES for the accreditation visits of community health centers (CSCom).
